title: How to Patch Hairline Cracks in Plaster

steps.headline: Make a runny paste for applying to the crack.
steps.description: To create the paste, use equal parts of table salt and laundry starch powder mixed together with water.

steps.headline: Clean the surface of the wall where the hairline cracks are.
steps.description: Use sugar soap or a similar wall cleanser.

steps.headline: Apply the paste using an artist's brush.
steps.description: This is delicate work, so it requires a delicate touch and the small brush is ideal. Fill and cover the crack with care.

steps.headline: Allow to dry before repainting over it.
steps.description: Obviously, match the paint with the existing wall paint.

steps.headline: Repeat if needed.
steps.description: When done, simply wash the paste off the brush and leave to air dry.
